project.title: Unity Station Exterior
project.description:
Concepts by Pablo Dominguez
Client: Christopher Paolini - To Sleep in a Sea of Stars
Creative Direction: Finnian MacManus

We had a fantastic time working with celebrated author Christopher Paolini (of the Eragon series) to bring his new book, To Sleep in a Sea of Stars, to life with some worldbuilding ! 

"Kira constructed Unity using technology drawn from the Seed‚Äôs vast store of knowledge. Unlike any human or Jelly station, it was an amalgam of organic and inorganic materials, filled with living, growing elements, an ecosystem drawn from different races to form a harmonious whole." - To Sleep in a Sea of Stars

project.description:

project.title: Smite Pele Skin 'Dragon's Dagger ' Concept art
project.description:
The lovely folks at Hi Rez approached me last year about doing some possible skins for Smite. When they told me it was Pele, I jumped at the chance. Sadly, my schedule never quite worked out to have the time to do more skins, but it'd be something I'd love to do more of if I go back to freelance at any time. I really enjoyed the process for this, even if my own armor designs drove me nuts in the turnaround. I'm sorry to the character artist who got lumped with them. 

I really loved the suggestion of playing with dragon opals as a colour scheme, and I love how the colours turned out in this. 

My thanks to John Bridges for all his guidance during this! 
https://www.artstation.com/redcrow

project.title: Exhale
project.description:
Funny how things just pour out of the subconscious when you kind of learn how to interpret it.
This one is a mix of personal feelings and a view on a tired mother nature, trying to keep up with everything we do to the planet and to ourselves...
I tried to illustrate her in a "heavenly" empty space, but also ground it as a possible art installation. I'm curious to take this to VR at some point.
Hope she makes you feel something. I'd be interested to hear about it. üíö

project.title: Flaktower
project.description:
What started out as a single prop, eventually turned into another small environment piece that I've put together recently.
-
Wanted to practice modelling something a bit more complicated than the usual bucket or a trash bag, so I decided to model the 8.8 cm flak gun.
Originally planned to post the gun by itself as a single prop. However, I thought that it would seem a bit out of place in my current portfolio, so I ended up making the interior of a flak tower as well.
-
Everything except the crates was modelled by me. 90% of the textures come from Megascans. Skies from HDRIhaven.

project.title: Bamboo Temple - Hiroshi Yoshida feat Princess Kaguya
project.description:
Hey everyone!

Just want to start by something like : LESS IS MORE! 
I started this project by creating some texture in designer with and handraw line style. When I was young, I loved to draw some dungeon. But after starting this, I saw kaguya Princess, a Ghibli movie, and I fell in love with the art style. By making some research about it, I find Hiroshi Yoshida (1876-1950), a super badass japanese painter from the  Shin-Hanga movement, and  it was clear that I really want to try to make something similar in 3D and in UE and by learning shaders and Post Process.
----------------------------------------------------
So here it is! I am currently happy with the result, but as usual all stuff could be better, and now that I know a bit more about Post-Process, I will make stuff differently. It was super fun to work with less and focus on what i really need to have this visual.
----------------------------------------------------
And thx to my good friends to follow me in this adventure :D 
And a big thank to internet ans the UE community, and of course, thx for the amazing talk of:
https://www.artstation.com/simont  
It's alway a pleasure to watch this amazing talk about vfx from RIME.
Talk here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ExD_p3hsV80&ab_channel=UnrealEngine

project.title: Hyper Scape - Mint Scrapper
project.description:
Here is Mint Scrapper from the game Hyper Scape. She is my favorite character on this game. 
She is the original Mint character whose other skins are based on. I was in charge of the whole process of creation, from blocking highpoly to integration and polish, supervised by Arnaud.
-
I had the pleasure to work on this amazing project at Ubisoft. It's one of the most refreshing and creative mandates I had at Ubisoft since we have the opportunity to create full characters with a large range of styles.
-
Credits :
Character Art Direction - Arnaud Kotelnikoff
https://www.artstation.com/arnaudkotelnikoff

project.title: Colorful Illustrations - Course
project.description:
I finally released a brand New online course !  47 min of packed content about Storytelling, Art fundamentals & more!
Get it on Artstation right here >> https://www.artstation.com/a/3024464
Here are the illustrations I will be covering during the class. Done with Procreate. 
-
‚Ä¢üé•  A 47 minutes narrated video about : 

    Building images from scratch
    My thoughts when creating illustrations
    Lectures on Storytelling, Fundamentals & more
    Tons of examples from Amazing artists
    Tips, and thoughts about Digital Painting
-
‚Ä¢‚úçÔ∏è  x1  Brush pack for Procreate

    This contains only 3 custom brushes :
         Sketchy, CircleHue, Hard Paint
    The rest of the brushes are default from Procreate that you can find directly in the App (added to the pack for convenience) :
        Tinderbox, Natural Brush, Soft Brush, Nikko Rull, Leatherwoord, Stuc, Noise Brush)
-
‚Ä¢üé• The 3 paintings from the course in single video files :

    Non narrated : These 3 processes are present in the main course with narration
    These files are here for your convenience if you want to go back and check only the process
-
‚ö†Ô∏è Important : This Course is for students, beginners and advanced artists, However be mindfiul that it does NOT cover the basis of Procreate, drawing, perspective, character design, and anatomy. Also this is NOT a step by step tutorial, this a lesson covering multiple Art topics and theories.
---
Thanks  to all the artists who gave me permission to showcase their work :
https://www.artstation.com/justingerardillustration
https://www.artstation.com/alexaccorsi
https://www.artstation.com/kyu
https://www.artstation.com/simeonschaffner

project.title: Atlas - Platform Robot
project.description: Atlas is a robot that designed to assist exploration team to quickly establish a flat working plane in complex terrain. locking mechanism on the side of the robots can allow multiple robots to assemble a larger platform quickly to establish a foundation of a lab or workshop in uncharted area. It can also serve as cargo units that can carry heavy equipments to high altitude terrian that conventional vehicle have hard time to travel on.

project.title: PEACEBRINGER | UE4
project.description:
PEACEBRINGER | UE4 is my take on an awesome drawing I saw by Sam Keating on Instagram! @_glintz_ https://www.instagram.com/p/BLWQ2HNDH61/
.
Modelled in Maya and ZBrush.
Baked and textured in Substance Painter.
Rigged and animated in Maya.
Materials, lighting, VFX and rendering in Unreal Engine.
Video Compositing in Photoshop.
.
This project was a great opportunity to showcase a variety of skills and it was a ton of fun! A nice blend of hard surface modelling and organic cloth sculpting. My favourite part of the creation process was texturing. I knew this was going to be blast in Substance Painter. Presenting in Unreal was a great chance to practice materials, lighting and rendering. Finally, I wanted to learn to rig and animate my model to add that extra something to my presentation. I have loved every minute of it! I hope that shows!
.
Sam, who I have had no contact with until now (lol) - I really hope you like it and I hope you like how I have interpreted your concept. I hope it brings you joy! :)
.
Thanks for reading!
________________________________
P.S.
- Big thanks to Tali Di Girolamo and Mathijs Kapteijn for guru level art guidance!
- James Drew for showing me the ropes with rigging!
- Nicolas Swijngedau for the nice Alpha cloth damage pack I used on the jacket!
- Monica Cappiello for her awesome (Academic Phoenix Plus) Beginner Rigging Tutorial Playlist
.
https://www.tdigirolamo.com/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1wvdQy2Fdhw&list=PLbxLlP-Vyt-_c3iKFxEFAurJa9KBDHVJB&ab_channel=AcademicPhoenixPlus
https://www.artstation.com/mathijskapteijn
https://www.artstation.com/nicolasswijngedau
https://www.artstation.com/glintz

project.title: Medieval Game Environment (UE4 & Megascans)
project.description:
A playable game environment I worked on together with the incredible Demo team at Quixel and Epic. My main task was to set dress the environment. If you want to check out the tutorial I put together on the topic of set dressing - you can find it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ufoNrkv62go

Daniel Woje (https://www.artstation.com/danwoje) did a marvelous job of art directing the project.

Download the project for free here: https://www.unrealengine.com/marketplace/en-US/product/scarecrow

Among MANY other things Jakob Keudel created the base houses for the entire village using Unreal Engine's modeling tools. Check out the tutorial he made on that topic in the Tutorial Playlist linked below.
Link to Jakob Keudel's Artstation: https://www.artstation.com/jakobkeudel

Check out the tutorial playlist here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HVJfJ010MQM&list=PL5uQePynMSiJbPyxo1ZC6jWnXEg4D3snk

Hats off to Matt Oztalay and Chris Murphy for their invaluable work on the tech side. Travis Naas and David Woje did a fantastic job with music and audio. And Galen Davis is an absolute star, helping out with the production side of things. <3 

And last but not least, a huge shout-out to the scanning and processing teams for their awesome work on the scans.

project.title: Necropolis of the Pale Moon [UE4]
project.description:
Necropolis of the Pale Moon is the final resting place for thousands of fallen soldiers in a great war many years ago. Some travelers go there to pay respects to their forefathers who shaped the world into how it is today.

Decided to try out a more stylized environment after having done mostly realistic ones in the past. I took heavy inspiration from Studio Ghibli films, mainly for the clouds, and tried to focus mainly on color, value and saturation of those colors establishing a mood. All lighting is dynamic and raytraced.

I really enjoyed working on this piece- it strongly fed into some life circumstances at the time.

Head over to the website to join the mailing list or follow them on twitter to keep up to date on this project!

project.title: Bram Stoker's Dracula
project.description: I'm a big fan Francis Ford Coppola and Bram Stoker's Dracula, I watched this movie when I was a kid and I was fascinated with the design of each character, so I decided to do a reinterpretation of the design, I took one night for each character. I used ZBrush to sculpt and Maya V-Ray to render.

platform: Old Man of the Fire - Itch.io

project.title: Hope
project.description:
Last year I saw a lot of darkness. I'm sure we all did.. Personally I dealt with being screwed over by people I used to trust, being forced to travel during a pandemic, and just trying to keep a clear head in general during all the chaos. It really pushed my limit. Amidst all the madness there was a lot of light and kindness as well; I met some of the greatest and coolest people I've ever known, landed an amazing new job where I'm inspired on a daily basis, became more in tune with myself and grew happier in many ways.

Looking back I can say that I'm incredibly grateful for everything that happened in my life the past year. The good and the bad.

This piece is a reminder for myself and perhaps others too, that even in the darkest times you always have to keep a little light in your thoughts. Stay cheerful, positive, be kind to others. Keep calm and don't let the negative thoughts lead you astray. Especially in times like these. I have hope that things will be better.

This project started as a horse study under the guidance of Krystal Sae Eua around July of last year and ended up turning into a lot more. She was incredibly helpful and really pushed my understanding of art in general. She's a great artist and a very kind person. I can only recommend her mentorship.
Here's her site:
https://www.artstation.com/iamsadpanda
Her workshop:
https://thementorcoalition.com/creature-art-mentorship

Rendered with Arnold GPU, sculpted in ZBrush.

Thanks for looking and reading if you did : ) !

project.title: Lego Study
project.description: Yeah, boring times during all the covid-19 days. During early 2020 (first lockdown) I spent 3 days with kids sorting out lego bricks by colors. We put together all of those beautiful transparent pieces aside and I made some pictures which inspired me to make some 3d version. I used redshift for rendering.. I have 2 GPUs (2080 and Titan). Rendering was pure hell‚Ä¶ all those refractions, caustics and dust‚Ä¶ tried other rendereres but none of them was even close to what I was able to achieve with Redshift.

project.title: Museum
project.description:
Museum - Final Project for Intro to 3D at Gnomon.

The assignment was to create an interior in Maya based on concept art. I had a great time working on this environment and was able to experiment with multiple new tools like MASH and diving deeper into Hypershade.

Modeled in Maya. Statue sculpted in ZBrush. Textures are a mix of Substance Designer, Painter, and Megascans. Rendered in V-Ray.

The beautiful, original concept by Rado Markovic

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/8y5JO

project.title: UE4: Realtime fur test on RTX 3080
project.description:
Quick test I've made to see how easy is to set up real-time fur in UE4 with Ray Tracing on. I've made a model and bust groom in Maya last year, but everything else, the rest of the body groom, basic rig and skin, few blend shapes for the head, simple animation, and Unreal scene, was made in a day for the sake of this test, so this is nowhere near finished Environment assets, "Tropical Jungle Pack" by PolyAsset3D
There is around 600k hairs that are running in real-time on RTX 3080 and AMD Ryzen 9 5900X with 64gb RAM, although I've got similar numbers with RTX 3080 and i7-2600K overclocked to 4.4GHz with 16gb RAM but with significant frame drops. I've imported Maya XGen alembic files without optimization and I think that framerate could be much higher if I did. Adding a bunch of assets didn't help ether
The process of setting up Groom Assets is not too complicated but there are a few things that require a bit of planning, especially if you work with XGen and need textured hair. There is a problem with DOF and groom ( there are artefacts around edges ) but as this is still a Beta I hope that would be solved in the future.
*Note: Groom physics simulation is not enabled because his fur is short.

project.title: Dealing with a cyborg
project.description:

I hope you enjoy the process (real time: 2h56min), and have a great week.

project.title: Frozen Dawn [UE4 Real-time]
project.description:
Living in the cloudy city like Saint-P and seeing sun for brief moments from time to time, you sometimes find yourself wondering how would it feel to observe the clear shiny dawn for once in a while.
--
This is my first organic environment. It based on stunning CGMA Organic World Building in UE4 course by Anthony Vaccaro. During working on this project I realized, how fascinating are procedural texturing process and technical aspect of shader art. That is why I was mostly focusing on materials and UE4 shaders creation this time.

Every assets was made by myself, modelled in Maya or sculpted in ZBrush. For texturing I was using Zbrush (chunky cliff), Substance Designer (snow and ice), Substance Painter (megascan canopy atlas adjustments) and Substance Alchemist (pine bark photoscan adjustments). Everything was put together in UE4 4.24.

P.S. Also I want to make a breakdown post about shaders, so stay tuned!

project.title: [UE4] Green - Interior Environment
project.description:
'Green' is a UE4 interior environment I made in my spare time during the new year breaks, to push myself in making realistic render with real-time engine. I don't have a beast PC so no ray-tracing and expensive lightmap, had to fake certain details.

It's inspired by a photo I saw on Pinterest, I was in love with the colour and composition-- and decided to create something based on it.
First off, I wanted something that feels 'Zen-y'. Then I want to turn this space into a more 'lived-in' looking place. I believe in the power of storytelling -- and I want people to be able to imagine there was someone lying down on the couch, chilling and reading just a moment ago.

I created/modified most props and lighted this scene myself, though some amazing props are found elsewhere. Special thanks to the DiNusty and Ngorns community, and everyone that has given me support and feedback!

project.title: Stroem
project.description:
Str√∏m‚Äîa homage to Raawii and Vilhelm Lundstr√∏m.

As fans of Vilhelm Lundstr√∏m‚Äôs work, we immediately fell in love with the Raawii Str√∏m Collection by Danish designer Nicholas Wiig Hansen. 

The clean geometric shapes and bright colors inspired us to create a homage where each object of the collection is treated as a character with it‚Äôs own characteristics. 

The result is a colorful and surreal world where ceramics come to life‚Äîone by one.

Concept and 3D by PomPom
Collection design by Nicholas Wiig Hansen
Sound design by Povel Olsson

project.title: Amazon-Halo
project.description: This project is an interesting case study in adaptability. Amazon initially came to us to help make auxiliary videos to help support a live action product launch for their new Halo device. But then the pandemic hit and live action was suddenly off the table ‚Äî Amazon was left in the lurch. If only they knew a full-service animation studio who could still deliver the goods...

project.title: 7-Seconds
project.description:
Intrigued by the what awaits us in the not too distant future, our team of specialists focused upon a mutual area of interest ‚Äì the power of technology in transforming our abilities and capabilities in the development of this visual.

With attention to detail and exquisite skill in getting the best out of CGI software, we came up with a visual that we believe will reflect reality in the time to come. We are always open for comments and critique and hope you enjoy the visual‚Äôs intricacies as much as we did in developing this piece of art.

project.title: Brabham-shading
project.description: This project is a small part of a big personal cgi challenge i'm doing currently and it is my first car render. I did all the shading of the car procedurally inside 3DS Max and i used V-Ray. It took more than i expected to finish it, considering it is a side personal project. I will probably work on it more in the future but now it works for its purpose and it is time to keep going with the main scene i'm making.\nThe car is a free model made by Szymon Kubicki: https:\/\/www.behance.net\/kubicki3d

project.title: DAYBE-SOFA-BED
project.description:
Daybe Sofa Bed by Northern. Designed by Morten & Jonas 2018

Daybe belongs to a new generation of daybeds designed to balance function and practicality with well-being and style. Although the sofa appears to form a fixed shape, the backrest detaches and slides onto the floor to create a comfortable bed. Unlike conventional sofa beds constructed from coils, springs and levers, Daybe converts into a bed in one smooth motion.

Daybe‚Äôs seat and backrest are underpinned by a lightweight metal frame available with or without armrests. The optional armrests are crafted from strips of smooth black metal that extend behind the sofa to form a streamlined backrest.

The armrests and backrest maximise Daybe‚Äôs comfort without affecting the ease with which it transforms into a bed and back again. Available in a variety of fabrics, the sofa provides relaxation during daytime and encourages deep sleep and sweet dreams at night.
